metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1829 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Requests (aka python-requests) before 2.3.0 allows remote servers to obtain a netrc password by reading the Authorization header in a redirected request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-requests - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1
python3-requests - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: requests package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1').
